io.github.thunderbots.lightning

Class Lightning

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.Lightning

  • public final class Lightning
extends java.lang.Object
    The Lightning class exposes methods for general interfacing with the hardware on the physical robot. The static methods in the class can be used for things such as accessing the joysticks, and getting hardware objects.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara, Pranav Mathur

    • Method Summary

      Gets a reference to the motor with the given name.
      static <T> T getSensor(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a reference to any sensor on the robot with the given name.

      Gets a reference to the servo with the given name.

      Gets a reference to the main task scheduler.

      • initializeLightning

        public static void initializeLightning(LightningOpMode opmode)
        Initializes the static members in Lightning from the given LightningOpMode.
        Parameters:
        opmode - the op mode to get information from.
        See Also:
        opmode

      • getTaskScheduler

        public static TaskScheduler getTaskScheduler()
        Gets a reference to the main task scheduler.
        Returns:
        a reference to the main task scheduler.
        See Also:
        taskScheduler

      • getJoystick

        public static Joystick getJoystick(int joystick)
        Gets a reference to the given joystick. Currently, only joystick1 and joystick2 are supported.
        Parameters:
        joystick - the ID of the joystick to return; can only be 1 or 2.
        Returns:
        the specified joystick.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given joystick ID is not 1 or 2.

      • getJoystickMonitor

        public static JoystickMonitor getJoystickMonitor(int joystick)
        Gets a reference to the joystick monitor for the given joystick. Currently, only joystick1 and joystick2 are supported.
        Parameters:
        joystick - the ID of the joystick to get the monitor for; can only be 1 or 2.
        Returns:
        the joystick monitor for the given joystick.
        See Also:
        monitor1, monitor2

      • getMotor

        public static Motor getMotor(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a reference to the motor with the given name. If there is no motor with the given name, but there is a servo with the given name, the servo is assumed to be a continuous-rotation servo, and a CRServo object representing that servo is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the motor.
        Returns:
        the motor with the given name.
        See Also:
        CRServo

      • getServo

        public static Servo getServo(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a reference to the servo with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the servo.
        Returns:
        the servo with the given name.

      • getSensor

        public static <T> T getSensor(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a reference to any sensor on the robot with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the sensor with the given name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no sensors exist with the given name.
